titleStmt.title: Gazophylacium anglicanum containing the derivation of English words, proper and common, each in an alphabet distinct : proving the Dutch and Saxon to be the prime fountains : and likewise giving the similar words in most European languages, whereby any of them may be indifferently well learned, and understood : fitted to the capacity of the English reader, that may be curious to know the original of his mother-tongue.

Gazophylacium anglicanum containing the derivation of English words, proper and common, each in an alphabet distinct : proving the Dutch and Saxon to be the prime fountains : and likewise giving the similar words in most European languages, whereby any of them may be indifferently well learned, and understood : fitted to the capacity of the English reader, that may be curious to know the original of his mother-tongue.
titleStmt.author: Skinner, Stephen, 1623-1667. Etymologicon onomasticon.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E.H. and W.H., and are to be sold by Randall Taylor ...,

notesStmt.note: "Etymologicon onomasticon, or, An etymological explication of the proper names of men and women : as also, of rivers, countries, cities, towns, villages, hills, mountains, ports and promontories": p. [395]-[556].
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
